name: Nasir Meidan, armed and dangerous.
description:
The idea is simple, but it takes a while to get used to: you try to build your rig on the fly, grabbing whatever breaker you need at the moment using PW or SMC, funded by your ability. You also try to set up all your recurring credits as early as possible so you have a steady late game economy.

Professional Contacts and Personal Workshop are foundations of the deck. I mulligan if I don't see at least one of them. They help you dig for what you need without having to lose tempo clicking for credits later, paying for something you don't need, or having to discard a card that could be useful later.

Atman is there in a support role, you use it to plug holes kind of like a Femme. Remember you can use your recurring credits to pay for it's str boost. That said, don't hesitate to use it as a primary breaker if the oportunity arises.

It's not packing any killers, Sharpshooter and Deus X are there to deal with the surprise nasty ones, while Atman can be a more permanent solution.

Unregistered S&W is vital against Caprice and Ash, while being still useful against other upgrades and assets that can be a pain.

name: Next stop...
description: A quick build for NBN:NEH. 18 assets let's me feel comfortable running less ICE. It also makes the economy strong enough to splurge on a flare as well as a full set of tollbooth. ICE is varied because my meta is starting to show Katman decks for the first time. I specifically went with private contracts over marked accounts since I rarely use MA but PC has saved me several times. Have fun and pray you don't come up against Whizzard. :)

name: The Ivory Tower
description: An academic fortress. Levy University researches all of your NEXT ice, Mother Goddess and Priority Requisition targets. Shipment from Mirrormorph lets you throw it out quickly, particularly in front of something you've just installed with Mushin No Shin. The ice threatens program trashing while the bluffed assets threaten damage. With mostly 5/3 agendas and Domestic Sleepers the runner has to steal three agendas to the two that you need to put on the table. It's more or less the HB version of Harmony Medtech.

name: I am the tax man. koo koo cachoo.
description: My reworked NBN deck. The entire purpose is to tax the runner so they can't afford to get past ASH, let alone afford NAPD contract. My original deck had more EtR ICE but I realized keeping the runner out isn't always necessary, just keeping them too poor to get past ASH. Katman has started showing up in my meta so I've reworked the ICE for more variety and a swordsman. I decided to put the Data ravens back in because my meta doesn't go tag me often and, if it does, I have 18 other ICE in the deck to play back up. Fast track is incredible in this deck. It was the sole reason I went 3-1 with this in a recent tournament, including a full win vs a timed win. The ability to pull an NAPD contract when the runner is broke or a breaking news to win is just silly.

name: Sashimitini and Crushed Ice - V8 - with Shaper Affectations
description:
Andromeda:

Wearing a red dress in a world of blue. Sashimi and Cocktails over Crushed Ice. Sea food as Ice breakers.

'Designed'... Hopefully, to profit from ice being rezzed and having some control over when it is rezzed. Profit is such an ugly word.

Andromeda doesn't like handling the money, so has people for that: "Can't have your accounts closed if you don't have any" she would say without acknowledging a history of privilege and entitlement: she can never quite get into the mindset of her Shaper and Anarch 'friends'.

Andromeda doesn't drink Diesel, nor would she be seen dead in Wyldeside, and she's not a particularly artful programmer: but she has people to go get the programs she needs and one or two tricks to keep hold of them.

Hopefully these people are more efficient than she is and if the compromised employees can't keep the tags at bay: who wears a dress like this and worries about visibility.

...

So: not quite back to basics... we're much too 'pretentious' for that, but the attempts at fixed combo's from previous versions have hopefully been replaced with cards that flow together more.

...

From previous version:

Out is Logos and Doppelganger, in is ... Dinosaurus to power up whichever iceabreaker type seems useful in the game as it stands.

Out are Ice Analyzer, and Retreival Run - the former sat on a small fortune most of the time and I had no place to spend it and the latter didn't save me much money anyway as none of my ice is too pricey.

In: Prepaid VoicePAD's to save money on running the events I do have, since i'll be hopefullly Same Old Thinging quite a lot. Also, I want more diversity in my economy.

In: Notoriety (in theme, good), but only one because like Sneakdoor Beta it probably only works as a lucky draw surprise for me anyway.

Swapped a Special Order for an Express Deliver as they're both doing the same thing, but figure the odds are good I don't always want an ice breaker.

We'll see.

name: Party Noise 1.1
description:
Edit of V1.0

Removed -Armitage Codebusting x3 -Liberated Accounts x2

Added -Daily Casts x3 -Dirty Laundry x3

name: Meat Sandwich
description:
This deck draws inspiration from a plethora of tag/bag decks posted on NetrunnerDB and from my local meta as well. Since my preferred style when I play MTG(Magic The Gathering) is direct damage aka burn, tag/bag is perfect for me. In Magic I "could" win via creature damage but I love the burn for the win. Even here, I "could" win via scoring agendas but I rather just smother the runner with meat damage. Only seven total agenda cards are in the deck. This allows the deck to support the addition of 2 Pad Campaigns for economy. Snares are there for the net damage annoyance and tagging. Sea Source is there if I want to force a Scorched Earth. And of course can't forget about Punitive Counter Strike for punishing the running for scoring agendas.

For ICE, 2 Draco to hold up against Account Siphon runs. 2 Grims to act as outer layers of ICE to trash programs, Taurus to destroy hardware and Hadrian's Wall is the big thick piece of ice the deck(just in case). Just like my burn deck in Magic, this deck is strong early/mid-game. The later the game goes you become more dependent upon scoring agendas which kinda sucks. Happy hunting! Runners, enjoy this delicious meat sandwich.

name: The Invisible Hand
description:
The basic idea is to use Domestic Sleepers to fuel Midseason Replacements. From that small pool I chose carefully to create The Invisible Hand that guides the game.

Agendas

Domestic Sleepers is the main idea, so 3x there. 3x Priority Requisition because with 3 0-point agendas, I need to make up deck space, and I'm not running a lot of Bioroids, so Project Wotan is less useful. Project Vitruvius lets me recur combo cards, and NAPD Contract costs the runner credits before a Midseason Replacements trace. Lastly the 1-of Gila Hands Arcology is there to round out points and build cash.

Assets

I kept it to 2x Jackson Howard to save influence, and 3x Eve Campaign for the money build. Adonis Campaign builds faster, but Eve costs the runner more to trash, which is just as good most of the time.

Operations

No surprises here: 3x Midseason Replacements and 2x Psychographics. The rest is money and recursion with Subliminal Messaging to help get the runner moving on your stuff.

Ice

This is where I went a little non-traditional. Common wisdom would be to go for taxing ice like Eli 1.0, and I did do that for some things like Viper, but I also wanted to force the runner to spend money, not clicks getting in. This gave me a NEXT suite with some extra tagging and a little program trashing (1x each of Archer, Ichi 1.0, and Rototurret). The idea here is to use the cheap NEXT ETR ice to score a little early to force the runner to not sit around and credit-up, and gives you another potential win condition rather than just sitting back and tagging.

name: Harmony Medtech: Stone Memorial Wing v.01
description: A very basic Medtech shell game deck using 5/3 agendas. Updated in v.02 with Mushin No Shin.

name: Harmony Medtech: Stone Memorial Wing v.02
description: A tweaked version of v.01 adding Mushin No Shin.

name: Mandatory Minimums
description:
Keep a Mandatory Upgrades alive for 3 rounds. Then you can fast advance everything else. Chimera, Mother Goddess, and Wraparound are probably what you'll want to use for your remote. Make them go look for an AI or Barrier breaker.

You can use domestic sleepers to to get rid of the source.

name: Post Mortem
description:
Another deck inspired by Anathomy of Anarchy, don't tag me version. A little more focused on unrezzing ices that could cost a little more than 5cr.

Why running HQ if you can't profit for agendas there ? This is the meaning of Legwork.

Cyber Threat because "yay cyber threat" ! :)

name: Sugar Momma
description: Andy deck with a ton of money.

name: value testing
description: run triggers, efficient runs and lots of bux

name: Nasir, Cyber Engineer (v.3)
description:
(v.3) New tests: MOpus instead of Kati (might be too heavy on mem, but I've included a second Cybersolutions Mem Chip just in case), +1 Sharpshooter, +1 Atman (love these guys with Nasir!), +1 Femme, -1 each Gord Blade and Battering Ram, +1 Djinn, +1 Imp (hard to trash things without it!), +3 Scavenge, -1 Indexing... I've left in Social Engineering for more testing, but I'm not 100% in love with it. Scavenges offer more play through Femme and Atman, and recursion of Parasites/Sharpshooter/Deus X.

(v.2) Some alterations to an earlier deck. Savoir-faire allows for bursty draw-run turns with Sahasrara to help install. Want to fit in Cyberfeeders. Atmans are for sentries and Engineering can be treated as a money card in this deck. Might need another indexing or some Maker's Eye to force a rez.
